alert.note: Alert for Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 24 at 1:46PM MST until December 25 at 12:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to 6 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Southern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until Noon MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, while drifting snow could lead to complete lane blockages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...In addition, some light rain may fall Saturday evening in the mountains. While air temperatures may be above freezing, rain may still freeze on contact with the frozen ground.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
